subject: Fish Story Example
msgSnippet: Excellent work on the QS font for the fish story example.  I love The Old Man and the Sea. Other posters have covered most of issues that I see in the
messageBody:
Excellent work on the QS font for the fish story example. I
love "The Old Man and the Sea."

Other posters have covered most of issues that I see in the
document. I won't comment on places where I might have spelled
things differently. Here are four comments on the font itself:

1. I'm a little puzzled why the shape of "Utter" is so different from
the shape of "Ever", "As," and "On" Shouldn't these all look similar?

2. As others have pointed out, the shape of "foot" and "ooze" should
definitely be more rounded. It's very difficult to tell "ooze"
from "eat" with this form.

3. I'm puzzled why the tail on "May" looks different from the tail
on "Fee" and "Vie." I'd probably not have added the tail at all, but
given that it's there, why is it different only on "May"?

4. It's not clear how the "Awe-Roe" ligature would be different from
the "On-Roe" ligature. (Did we see "Awe-Roe" in the document?) A
more acute joining would probably help here.

Thank you for a glorious addition to the QS universe. With some
minor tweaks, I could see this becoming the new standard for Junior
Quickscript typefaces.

Best regards,
DelRayVA

Excellent work on the QS font for the fish story example.  I 
love "The Old Man and the Sea."

Other posters have covered most of issues that I see in the 
document.  I won't comment on places where I might have spelled 
things differently.  Here are four comments on the font itself:

1. I'm a little puzzled why the shape of "Utter" is so different from 
the shape of "Ever", "As," and "On"  Shouldn't these all look similar?

2. As others have pointed out, the shape of "foot" and "ooze" should 
definitely be more rounded.  It's very difficult to tell "ooze" 
from "eat" with this form.

3. I'm puzzled why the tail on "May" looks different from the tail 
on "Fee" and "Vie."  I'd probably not have added the tail at all, but 
given that it's there, why is it different only on "May"?

4. It's not clear how the "Awe-Roe" ligature would be different from 
the "On-Roe" ligature.  (Did we see "Awe-Roe" in the document?)  A 
more acute joining would probably help here.

Thank you for a glorious addition to the QS universe.  With some 
minor tweaks, I could see this becoming the new standard for Junior 
Quickscript typefaces.

Best regards,
DelRayVA
